questions.text: In the standard Sprunki Incredibox mod, which accessory typically triggers the 'Horror' mode transformation?
questions.explanation: Placing the Black Hat on the central character (Wenda) shifts the game into its dark/horror state.

questions.text: Which platform was the Sprunki mod originally created on?
questions.explanation: Sprunki gained fame as a project on the MIT Scratch platform before expanding.

questions.text: What is the name of the studio that created the original Incredibox game?
questions.explanation: The French studio 'So Far So Good' released the original Incredibox in 2009.

questions.text: In the Sprunki lore, what visual change indicates a character has been corrupted?

options.C: Bleeding eyes or dark void faces

questions.explanation: Horror mode features gore, bleeding eyes, and dark, distorted features.

questions.text: How many main character slots are available to mix in a standard Incredibox version?
questions.explanation: Most versions features 7 distinctive characters/slots to build the mix.

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a standard sound category in the game?
questions.explanation: Standard categories are Beats, Effects, Melodies, and Voices. Explosions are not a category.

questions.text: What is the primary color of the 'Sunny' (Oren) character in their default state?
questions.explanation: Oren is associated with the color Orange.

questions.text: The Sprunki mod became a viral sensation primarily on which social media platform?
questions.explanation: Like many modern mods, it gained massive traction via TikTok trends and edits.

questions.text: In the horror mode, the music style shifts from upbeat rhythms to what?
questions.explanation: The audio becomes distorted, glitchy, and unsettling to match the visuals.

questions.text: Which year represents the release of the original Incredibox (V1)?
questions.explanation: The first version was released as a Flash game in 2009.

questions.text: Which Sprunki character is typically associated with the 'Beats' category and wears headphones?
questions.explanation: Oren is often the first beat character introduced.

questions.text: In 'Phase 2' of some fan expansions, what beverage is often referenced in the title or theme?
questions.explanation: Phase 2 is often referred to as 'Cappuccino & Friends'.

questions.text: What is the primary function of the 'Mute' button in the gameplay interface?

options.A: Removes the character from the stage

questions.explanation: Mute allows you to silence a track without removing the character.

questions.text: Which of these characters is considered a 'Vocal' type?
questions.explanation: Wenda is a prominent vocal character in the Sprunki lineup.

questions.text: In the 'Horror' lore, what happens to the sky or background?

options.A: It turns pitch black or dark red

questions.explanation: The atmosphere shifts to a dark, often red or black void.

questions.text: What action typically removes a character from the stage?

options.B: Dragging them down/off the character slot

questions.explanation: Dragging the icon off the character model or clicking to deactivate is standard.

questions.text: The 'Midnight' phase (Phase 3) generally features what kind of aesthetic?
questions.explanation: Phase 3 is often associated with a night/moon theme.

questions.text: Which character name is a play on the word 'Computer'?
questions.explanation: One of the vocal characters is literally named 'Computer' (or V1).

questions.text: What does the 'Solo' button do during playback?

options.B: Mutes all other characters except the selected one

questions.explanation: Solo isolates a single track for emphasis.

questions.text: The 'Nightmare' phase (Phase 4) is considered:
questions.explanation: Phase 4 usually represents the peak of the horror transformation.

questions.text: Which category corresponds to the color Purple in standard Incredibox logic?
questions.explanation: Effects are typically color-coded Purple.

questions.text: Which category corresponds to the color Red in standard Incredibox logic?
questions.explanation: Melodies are typically color-coded Red.

questions.text: Who is 'Durple'?

options.B: A Melody character (often associated with Purple/Red)

questions.explanation: Durple is a melody character found in the lineup.

questions.text: What file format is commonly used for the loop samples in the web version?
questions.explanation: WAV is preferred for seamless looping in Web Audio API.

questions.text: In the horror version, 'Fun Bot' often appears:
questions.explanation: The robotic characters take on a dilapidated or evil appearance.

questions.text: The phrase 'Sprunki' is a fan-made derivative of:

options.C: Incredibox (Sprunki is a specific mod name)

questions.explanation: Sprunki is the specific name given to this modded universe of Incredibox.

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a valid character ID format in the config?
questions.explanation: Standard packs use b (beats), e (effects), m (melodies), v (vocals) prefixes.

questions.text: To reset the entire stage, players typically press:
questions.explanation: A dedicated UI button clears all active slots.

questions.text: Can you mix characters from different phases in the standard game logic?
questions.explanation: Standard logic loads one pack at a time due to asset compatibility.

questions.text: The 'Black Hat' item is unique because:

options.B: It triggers a mode switch rather than just adding a sound

questions.explanation: It functions as a trigger for the global Horror Mode state.
